#-----main-----

n = int(input())
a = list(map(int, input().split()))

# create a dictionary with the elements of the array as keys and their positions as values
# the last position will be the rightmost one
d = {}
for i in range(n):
    d[a[i]] = i

# sort the dictionary by the values
sorted_d = sorted(d.items(), key=lambda x: x[1])

# print the number of unique elements
print(len(sorted_d))

# print the unique elements
for i in range(len(sorted_d)):
    print(sorted_d[i][0], end=' ')

n = int(input())
a = list(map(int, input().split()))

b = []
for i in range(n):
    if a[i] not in b:
        b.append(a[i])

print(len(b))
print(*b)

def main():
    n = int(input())
    a = list(map(int, input().split()))
    b = list(set(a))
    b.sort(key = lambda x: a.index(x))
    print(len(b))
    print(*b)

main()

def main():
    n = int(input())
    a = list(map(int, input().split()))
    a.reverse()
    b = []
    for i in a:
        if i not in b:
            b.append(i)
    print(len(b))
    print(*b[::-1])

main()

n = int(input())
a = list(map(int,input().split()))

b = []
for i in range(n):
    if a[i] not in b:
        b.append(a[i])

print(len(b))
print(*b)
